result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Bail/Bond

09:59 AM 22CF28 and 22CM4. Defendant Christopher Scott Powell in court with attorney Steven Daniel Johnson.  Defendant Christopher Scott Powell in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Scott Powell appeared by video means with Attorney.  All appearances are by Zoom. Attny Johnson makes argument for bond modification. State indicates these are not victim rights cases. State objects to any modification. Court questions Attny Johnson and Defendant. Remarks by the Court. The Court will not modify bond.
Routed to JA
Bail/bond hearing on May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:45 PM Defendant Christopher Scott Powell in court with attorney Steven Daniel Johnson.  Defendant Christopher Scott Powell in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Scott Powell appeared by video means with Attorney. All parties via zoom.  Atty Johnson waives time limits for p.h. 22CM4 Atty Johnson heard on that case. CC doesn't have on docket. Court goes over waiver of preliminary examination with def.    Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause. 22CM4 Warrant Status. CC vacates warrant.    Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Atty Johnson enters Not Guilty plea. Court receives Not Guilty.  Previously bond reinstated.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:51 AM Defendant Christopher Scott Powell not in court.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  This case was set for yesterday and calling today as no appearance.  State request warrant $500 or body, Langlade/Adj. Court authorize warant $500 cash or body, Langlade/Adj.
Bail/Bond

02:07 PM Defendant Christopher Scott Powell in court, in custody.  Kelly Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Scott Powell appeared by video means. All appearances are by Zoom.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. plans to contact PD. Def. on PO hold. State heard on bond, recommends $1,000 signature bond. The Court orders $1,000 signature bond with standard bond conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
